qas.question: What foundation was laid that is the demographics of Modern Irish Enlightenment Era

context: Before the establishment of the Modern Greek state, the link between ancient and modern Greeks was emphasized by the scholars of <a0_0><b4_0>Greek Enlightenment<b4_0/><a0_0/> especially by Rigas Feraios. In his "Political Constitution", he addresses to the nation as "the people descendant of the Greeks". <a1_0>The modern Greek state was created in <b5_0>1829<b5_0/>,<a1_0/> when <a2_0>the <b6_0>Greeks liberated a part of their historic homelands, Peloponnese, from the Ottoman Empire<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The large Greek diaspora and merchant class were <a3_0>instrumental in transmitting the <b7_0>ideas of western romantic nationalism and philhellenism, which together with the conception of Hellenism<b7_0/>,<a3_0/> formulated during the last centuries of the Byzantine Empire, formed the basis of the Diafotismos and the current conception of Hellenism.
